column4: i have to admit it would be great if the next version of ubuntu doesn't ensure that every new installed program has to be tweaked to get it to work
i seem to have to tweak every program i install
and i still can't get hibernate to work - that's the shell app
like what? what programs do you have to tweak, and for what?
i've used the wrong word when I say tweak. I usually have to fiddle with screen dimensions, comp settings, etc. to get things to work
so have I, but that doesn't stop me
it's not stopping me either
I would love to be able to hibernate properly through shell tho
the hibernate application doesn't hibernate properly
which means if I want to hibernate/suspend i have to always do it through the GUI
so troubleshoot it, google it
it's difficult without a log
see, it powers down but i just doesn't power up afterward
thanks but I have it installed and it works. I just need help adding extra components
aah... haven't used it, i usually use the little gnome applet
well this one does have a GUI :)
one thing to note though is that installing qtstalker any other way than adding it to the repositories in ibex will fail
dude, gnome is all about gui ;) but i'm game for anything that'll help
if you want it add deb http://www.zwets.com/debs unstable/ to your /etc/apt/sources.list
sec, i'm installing the base from ibex to see how bad it is
it will install it just won't get the quotes for you
which defeats the purpose of having the program lol
I would personally like it a lot better if I could set it up the way I like butI don't know how to :/
